comments.body:
This is a good catch!

One more idea is to create an automatic test to check all the aggregate functions and make sure `defaultResult` matches the actual behavior: initialize the aggregate buffer and get the result directly.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +206,210 @@   * Result of the aggregate function when the input is empty.
   */
  def defaultResult: Option[Literal] = None

  /**
